lead_paragraph: Melih Gokcek’s Twitter posts were an effort to highlight what he saw as hypocrisy shown by the United States government and media in taking other countries to task for their human rights lapses.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Turkey: A Mayor Berates a U.S. Official
headline.main: Turkish Mayor Berates State Department’s Marie Harf for Silence on Baltimore Unrest

snippet: Melih Gokcek’s Twitter posts were an effort to highlight what he saw as hypocrisy shown by the United States government and media in taking other countries to task for their human rights lapses.
abstract: Melih Gokcek, mayor of Turkish capital of Ankara, posts flood of derogatory remarks about State Dept spokeswoman Marie Harf, criticizing her for not speaking out about death of a black man in Baltimore while in police custody; postings appear to be response to Harf's criticism of excessive force used by Turkish police during antigovernment protests in 2013.
